frameDefinitions: A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.
Words in the frame refer to any Document that has a legal status or conventional social significance.
This frame concerns Acts and State_of_
A Competition comes to an end, with a Competitor tying, winning, or losing against an Opponent (or opponents) according to their Score.
A Survivor manages to avoid being negatively affected, despite encountering a Dangerous_situation.
A Process comes to an end.
frameExamples: They got their marriage <t>licence</t> from Canada.
A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money <t>violates</t> the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.
Unbelievable--he <t>lost</t> the gold medal by just .02 points!
Wilderness Survival: Could You <t>Survive</t> the Wild?
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the name of the <fen>Process</fen> that occurs.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The holder of the document.
The authority that issues the document.
Obligation is the obligation that is imposed on the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>.
Right is the right of the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>  that is authorized by the <fen>Document</fen>.
Status is the state of the Bearer of the Document indicated by the Document.
Document is the piece of paper that has the legal status.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule.
This role identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.
The individual involved in the <fen>Competition</fen>.
The individual that the <fen>Competitor</fen> has been competing against.
The individuals who compete against each other.
The event in which the <fen>Competitors</fen> compete with each other.
The time at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Survivor</fen> lives through a <fen>Dangerous_situation</fen>.
The <fen>Dangerous_situation</fen> is one in which people are likely or expected to be negatively affected.
The time at which the surviving takes place.
The location where the <fen>Survivor</fen> (primarily) lives during the <fen>Dangerous_situation</fen>.
Name of the event which occurs.
When the event ends.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>US consulate</fex> issued a Visa to Ms. Yang to travel to San Francisco.
They were all under subpoena <fex>to appear in court.</fex>
The couple just got their <fex>marriage</fex> certificate.
The police need a search <fex><t>warrant</t></fex> to enter his house.
Jo's <fex><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.
John violated <fex>the law</fex> by not paying taxes.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Florida residents survived the devastating triple punch of Hurricanes Frances, Ivan and Jeanne,
